links.title: Spotify Looks At Unveiling A Long-Term Strategy The Music Industry Won't Like
links.description: A new report suggests that Spotify is embarking on a new strategy that may ultimately alienate the very partners it needs to stay in business. A recent Billboard article outlined Spotify's currently unannounced program of offering advances to a select number of indie artists for a direct licensing deal with the service.

links.title: Seven Things Apple Introduced That Could Improve Your Life
links.description: After a year filled with bug fixes and heavy user criticism, Apple's focus at its annual software showcase was on improving existing things rather than introducing new ones. And a few could actually make your life better.

messages.body: $AAPL Next-gen #Apple Watch models to integrate solid-state buttons & EKG functions, report says https://appleinsider.com/articles/18/06/08/next-gen-apple-watch-integrates-solid-state-buttons-that-simulate-clicks-with-haptic-feedback-report-says

links.title: Next-gen Apple Watch models to integrate solid-state buttons & EKG functions, report says
links.description: According to a fresh rumor, Apple is planning to do away with movable switch controls on Apple Watch devices and will in a future release integrate solid-state buttons that rely on Taptic Engine technology to simulate clicks. The buttons also include capacitive elements for advanced health monitoring capabilities.

messages.body: $AAPL great write up on WWDC 2018: So much more than a keynote https://www.imore.com/wwdc-2018-so-much-more-keynote

links.title: WWDC 2018: So much more than a keynote
links.description: I know it can be confusing for people who see WWDC only through the lens of product events, and wonder why crowds are congregating the day before and tweeting up to a week later, but Apple's World Wide Developer Conference has never been just about the keynote. That's the gala, not the gold.

links.title: Apple's Conscious Uncoupling
links.description: In Brand Strategy, we introduce the concept of laddering, an attempt to deposition a competitor by highlighting an attribute or area where they are weak. It's the corporate equivalent of buying your wife an exceptional Mother's Day gift because: 1) you love her; and 2) you want to highlight what a shitty gift she got you for Father's Day.

messages.body: $AAPL Jim Cramer isn't buying anecdotes about lower iPhone production. https://stocknews.com/news/aapl-cramer-dont-believe-negative-reports-surrounding-apple-inc-aapl/

links.title: Cramer: Don't Believe Negative Reports Surrounding Apple Inc. (AAPL)
links.description: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) shares slid on Friday after a Nikkei report said key iPhone suppliers were told to expect much lower demand for their parts. Specifically, the report identified a 20% drop in current generation iPhone sales estimates, from 100 million units down to 80 million units.
